Name: Zahiyah Raja Shihadah Judah
Notes: Shot in the head by an officer with the Border Police undercover unit from a distance of about 50 meters, as Border Police forces that had raided the camp were retreating. Judah was sitting on the roof of her fourth-floor house with about 20 of her grandchildren, most of them minors. According to the police, the officer fired during a violent disturbance in which another officer was hit on the head by a rock. According to the family, no stones were thrown from the roof. Her body was evacuated by an Israeli ambulance, and soldiers at the checkpoint refused to allow family members to accompany her in their cars. The body was returned to the family that evening.

Name: Amanah Ibrahim Muhammad Ya'qub
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at Haris Junction (Gitay Avisar Junction). The military claimed she threw stones at cars on the road and a knife was found on her body. Israel is holding her body.

Name: Fayzah Fathi 'Abd a-Rahman Abu Ghali
Notes: Killed when Israeli forces, including Special Police Unit, military and Shin Bet personnel, threw a grenade into her remote home’s yard, while she stepped out to listen to the muazzin’s call for dawn prayer. The forces then raided the house and detained her husband, two sons, and two grandchildren, ages seven and 13. The incident occurred during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. Abu Ghali’s husband and two grandchildren were held for several hours in the Jalameh military camp and then released. Her body was handed over to the Red Crescent later that day. Over the course of the day, the Israeli forces killed three more Palestinians in the city.

Name: Rahaf Fouad 'Abdallah al-Ashqar
Notes: Killed with her father when Israeli forces detonated an explosive device they placed next to her front door during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. The military claims intelligence information indicated an armed operative was in the house, and the forces notified the residents before detonating the bomb on a loudspeaker. However, B'Tselem's investigation indicates the occupants never heard a call. After blowing up the door, the soldiers used a Palestinian as a human shield to approach the house and tell all the men to step out. They then detained al-Ashqar's uncle, who was placed in administrative detention. The forces remained in the house for about 15 minutes but did not provide any medical attention to al-Ashqar or her father.

Name: Baraah Khaled Muhammad 'Atar
Notes: Wounded in the head by shrapnel from a missile fired from an aircraft that hit a shed in the yard of a neighbor's house, as she stood by her window with two relatives, one of whom was lightly injured. The occupant of the neighboring home was killed in her kitchen by a missile fragment that struck her head. The three women were taken to hospital, where ‘Attar was pronounced dead. During the raid on the camp, a Palestinian was killed in a fire exchange with the Israeli armed forces, and four others, including a minor, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft.

Name: Khawlah 'Ali 'Abdallah 'Abdu
Notes: Killed in her kitchen by a missile fragment that hit her head. The missile was fired from an aircraft and hit the shed in her yard. Two women in a neighboring house were also wounded by shrapnel. One of them died of her wounds shortly after. During the raid on the camp, a Palestinian was killed in a fire exchange with the Israeli armed forces, and four others, including a minor, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft.

Name: Hanan 'Abd a-Rahman Kayed Abu Salameh
Notes: Shot and wounded in the chest while harvesting olives with family members on their land, about 200 meters away from the separation fence. The soldiers stopped their vehicle on the “security road” adjacent to the fence, and a soldier who got out of it fired at the family members without warning. About two hours earlier, a soldier fired into the air from the "security road" while the family were harvesting in a plot closer to the fence, which was why they moved to the plot where Abu Salameh was shot. Her family members transported her in a car to an ambulance that took her to the hospital, where she was pronounced dead.

Name: Saja Naser Muhammad Khreiwish
Notes: Killed with her husband and their two minor children in their apartment when missiles fired from an aircraft hit their three-story residential building. The missile was fired as part of a targeted killing in which all 18 Palestinians in the building were killed, including her brother and another minor. The other 14 casualties, including a minor, were killed in a café on the ground floor of the building. According to the military, Palestinian operatives of armed groups who were in the café were planning an attack on Israeli civilians.

Name: Zuhour Qassem 'Abd a-Rahim 'Amur
Notes: Shot in the arm and back by soldiers while sitting with other women in her relatives’ yard during a condolence visit. The soldiers surrounded a house and arrested a resident in an elevated area of the village, then fired from there towards the yard. Two minors were wounded in the shooting, one of them a resident of the house, as well as an elderly woman. The injured were taken to a medical center in a nearby village, where ‘Amur was pronounced dead.

Name: Hibat Allah Shihadah Musleh 'Obeid
Notes: Wounded by shots fired by Israeli soldiers or Border Police officers when she stepped out with her mother to see what the commotion outside was about, during a raid of the refugee camp by Israeli forces. The Israeli forces also shot and wounded a paramedic who tried to evacuate her. She was pronounced dead at the hospital. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the Israeli armed forces killed four more Palestinians.

Name: Bayan Muhammad Jum'ah Salem 'Obeid
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with her mother and three armed Palestinians, who were near them on the street, during a raid by military, Border Police and Shin Bet personnel. The three men were the target of a military assassination. During the raid, a fire exchange between Israeli forces and Palestinian operatives took place elsewhere in the camp. One operative was killed by Israeli forces’ gunfire. A video posted on social media shows a military bulldozer taking the bodies of four of the dead away. Israel is holding her body.

Name: Iman 'Abdallah Salem 'Obeid
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with her daughter and three armed Palestinians, who were near them on the street, during a raid by military, Border Police and Shin Bet personnel. The three men were the target of a military assassination. A’beid was killed minutes after taking a photo holding one of the armed men’s firearms. During the raid, a fire exchange between Israeli forces and Palestinian operatives took place elsewhere in the camp. One operative was killed by Israeli forces’ gunfire. A video posted on social media shows a military bulldozer taking the bodies of four of the dead away.

Name: Nisrin Khaled 'Ali Damiri
Notes: Killed when a missile fired from an aircraft hit the tin roof of her kitchen, while she was sitting in the living room with her sister-in-law, who was wounded. The missile was fired while armed Palestinians were shooting at Israeli forces as they retreated after a raid of nearby Nur Shams Refugee Camp, where they destroyed infrastructure. A soldier was killed by an IED explosion at the beginning of the raid. During their retreat, the Israeli forces fatally shot a minor who was standing on a street in the city.

Name: Maymunah 'Abd al-Hamid Muhammad Harahshah
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli soldiers at a military post on Route 60, according to the military, after attempting to stab one of them. Israel is holding her body.

Name: Labibah Faze' Sidqi 'Alian
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint, according to the military, after attempting to stab one of them. Israel is holding her body.

Name: 'Ahd Mahmoud Yusef Awlad Muhammad
Notes: Shot in the head by soldiers while standing on her rooftop, calling out to her husband, who was in the street while Palestinians threw stones and Molotov cocktails at soldiers and Border Police officers in clashes that developed after the Israeli forces entered the town and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, another Palestinian was killed and at least 10 were wounded by the forces’ fire. The forces also used a town resident as a human shield.

Name: Duha Nabih 'Abd a-Rahman Abu 'Eid
Notes: Fatally shot along with her husband by Border Police officers, after the husband broke through a checkpoint in their car and ran over a police officer, lightly injuring her. A four-year-old girl who arrived at the checkpoint in a shared taxi with her mother and three siblings was also killed by the officers’ gunfire. Israel held her body until 29 February 2024.

Name: Rihab Mustafa Muhammad Yosef
Notes: A cancer patient who was wounded by fragments inside an ambulance that was taking her home from the hospital, during clashes in which a minor who threw stones and tried to throw an improvised explosive device at military jeeps near the hospital was fatally shot. That day, four more Palestinians, a minor and three armed operatives, were struck by a missile fired from an aircraft and either killed or wounded and died of their wounds later. In the remaining two days of the invasion, six more Palestinians were killed, all operatives of armed groups, two of them minors. Dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

Name: Randah 'Abdallah 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Ajaj
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers at a flying checkpoint while riding in a car with her husband, their two sons, an infant and an 18-year-old. A B'Tselem investigation disproved the military's claim that the incident involved an attempted car attack. The investigation revealed that the father saw soldiers, apparently wearing civilian clothes, suspected they were settlers, panicked, sped up and tried to escape. The soldiers fired at least two bullets at the car, killing the mother and wounding the elder son.

Name: Mirvat Saleh Muhammad Khaswan
Notes: Killed together with her husband and son when a missile struck her home and the home of her neighbor, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was killed together with his son and daughter, both minors. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Daniyah 'Alaa 'Ata 'Adas
Notes: Killed together with her sister, a minor, in their home, when a missile struck their building. A senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, his wife and his minor daughter were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Layla Majdi Mustafa al-Bahtini
Notes: Killed together with her daughter, a minor, and her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home. Two sisters living in the same building, one of them a minor, were also killed in the strike. Six other Palestinians were wounded in the strike.

Name: Wafaa Nimer Tawfiq Ghanam
Notes: Killed together with her husband, a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative, when a missile struck their home.

Name: Iman Ziad Ahmad 'Odeh
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers, according to the military, after she attacked one of them with a knife, causing a minor injury.

Name: Majedah 'Abd al-Fatah Mahmoud 'Obeid
Notes: Shot in the neck and chest by Israeli forces while in her home, during an exchange of fire that developed between armed Palestinians and the forces upon their entry into the camp. Eight more Palestinians, including two minors, three Islamic Jihad military wing operatives and an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative, were killed in the incident, and 20 were injured. One of the injured men, an Islamic Jihad military wing operative died of his wounds on 29 January 2023.

Name: Hanaa Isma'il 'Ali Dweik
Notes: Killed at home along with her son when guided bombs hit their building, also killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Alaa Saleh 'Abd al-Muhsen al-Mallahi
Notes: Killed at home when guided bombs hit her building, killing three senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, another building resident and her son, and a minor living in a nearby building. Additionally, 51 Palestinians, including 23 minors and 14 women, were wounded in the attack.

Name: Duniana 'Adnan 'Atiyyah al-'Amur
Notes: Wounded in the head and chest from a tank shell while at home, about one kilometer away from the Gaza perimeter fence. Her mother and sister were wounded in the attack. Died of her wounds shortly after.

Name: Ghufran Harun Hamed Warasnah
Notes: Journalist. Seriously wounded in the chest by soldiers’ gunfire after, according to the military, she approached them holding a knife. Died of her wounds a short while later.

Name: Shireen Nasri Anton Abu Akleh
Notes: Journalist. Fatally shot in the head during a military incursion into a nearby refugee camp. Investigations conducted by global media and B’Tselem determined that all the findings indicated that the gunfire was issued by the military from a spot where military vehicles were standing, about 200 meters away. Another journalist was hit in the shoulder by the gunfire, and additional shots were fired at a Palestinian who tried to evacuate her from the scene.

Name: Ghadah Ibrahim 'Ali Hassan
Notes: Wounded in the thigh by the gunfire of soldiers standing at a checkpoint in the village, after she approached them with her hands raised. Died of her wounds a short while later.

Name: Maha Kazem 'Awad a-Za'tari
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers after, according to the police, she stabbed a Border Police officer, lightly injuring him. Israel held her body until 23 December 2022.

Name: Hanan Mahmoud 'Abd a-Ra'uf Khaddur
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire while traveling in a shared taxi, during clashes that broke out in the city shortly after the killing of an Islamic Jihad military wing operative in the nearby refugee camp.

Name: Israa Khaled 'Aref Khzeimiyyah
Notes: Wounded by Israel Police and Border Police officers’ gunfire near Bab a-Silsila, one of the entrances to the al-Aqsa compound, after, according to the police, she tried to stab them. Succumbed to her wounds a short while later. Israel held her body until 19 November 2021.

Name: Mai Khaled Yusef 'Afanah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after she tried to run them over and, according to the military, got out of the car brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 August 2022.

Name: Ibtesam Khaled Saleh Ka'abneh
Notes: Fatally shot by a security guard at Qalandiya Checkpoint after, according to the police, advancing towards security guards and Border Police officers while brandishing a knife. Israel held her body until 23 July 2021.

Name: Huda Salah Rabi' al-Khazandar
Notes: Killed at her home, which was hit in an attack on a neighbors’ house. Her husband, son, and 10 other people were injured in the incident.

Name: Wafa 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd a-Razeq Barad'i
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after opening fire at soldiers and civilians at the entrance to a settlement. In video footage posted on social media, gunfire is heard lasting after Barad’i is already lying wounded on the ground. Israel is holding her body.

Name: Sa'diyah Yusef Taher al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, son, daughter, two daughters-in-law, six of their grandchildren, including two minors, their grandson's wife and their four-month-old great-grandson, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Bahaa Amin Muhammad al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her parents, brother, two sisters-in-law, six of her nephews, two of them minors, her nephew's wife and the four-month-old son of one of the nephews, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: 'Abir Nimer 'Ali Ishkuntana
Notes: Killed at home with her four children, between the ages of two and nine, in a building owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family in which 17 other people were killed, including six minors. In addition, 22 members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family were killed, six of them minors including a four-month-old baby, who lived in two adjoining buildings. Two other people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Du'aa 'Omar 'Abdallah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, two of their children, both of them minors, her brother-in-law and three of their children, all minors, and 14 other people from her husband's extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Amal Jamil Salamah al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with three of her children, two of them minors, her in-laws, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and 14 other people from her extended family, including three minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Ayat Ibrahim Khalil al-Kolak (al-Qolaq)
Notes: Killed with her husband, their four-month-old son, and 19 other people from her husband's extended family, including six minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Riham Fawaz Amin al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with her father, grandparents, two brothers, a sister-in-law and her four-month-old son, two aunts, her uncle's wife and three of her children, two of them minors, as well as eight people from their extended family who lived in two adjoining buildings, including five minors. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Khitam Musa Hashem al-Kolak
Notes: Killed with her in-laws and 19 other people from their extended family, including eight minors, who lived in two adjoining buildings. In another nearby building, owned by the Abu al-'Oaf family, 22 people were killed, including nine minors. In a fourth building located about 500 meters from the others, two occupants were killed. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Rawan 'Alaa Subhi Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with her parents and sister, seven other people from her extended family, and 12 other occupants, including nine minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Rim Ahmad Khalil Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, two of her children, her in-laws, four other people from her husband's extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Subhiya Isma'il Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with nine members of her extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a residential building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Shaimaa 'Alaa Subhi Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with her mother and sister, seven other members of her extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Majdiyah Khalil Hussein Abu al-'Oaf
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, their son, their daughter-in-law and two of their grandchildren, both minors, as well as four people from their extended family and 12 other occupants, including eight minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Rajaa Subhi Isma'il al-Ifranji
Notes: Killed with her four children, all minors, while visiting relatives in a building owned by the extended family, in which 17 other people, including six minors, were killed. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Diana Ziad Muhyi a-Din Abu al-'Oaf (al-Yazji)
Notes: Killed at home with her two daughters, seven members of her husband's extended family and 12 other occupants, including 10 minors, in a building owned by the family. Twenty-two members of the al-Qoolaq (Kolak) family, six of them minors, including a four-month-old baby, were killed in two adjacent buildings. Two more people were killed in a fourth building about 500 meters away. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network ran under the street.

Name: Yasmin Muhammad Khamis Abu Hatab
Notes: Killed at home with four of her children, all minors, and her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, who were staying with them. The house was completely destroyed and five nearby houses were partially destroyed. Yasmin's husband, 'Alaa Abu Hatab, is a Hamas military wing operative, but it is unkown whether he was the target of the attack.

Name: Maha Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aal al-Hadidi
Notes: Killed with four of her children, all minors, as well as her sister-in-law and four of her children, all minors, in an airstrike on the home of her sister-in-law and her brother, 'Alaa Abu Khatab, a Hamas military wing operative, where she was staying with her five children.

Name: Lamyaa Hassan Muhammad al-'Attar
Notes: Killed at home with her three young children, including a nine-month-old baby. Her husband and 13 other occupants of the building were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Fayzah Ahmad Muhammad Salamah
Notes: Killed at home. Her husband and son were injured. According to the military, the Hamas tunnel network passed by the house.

Name: Halimah 'Ali Muhammad al-Madhun
Notes: Killed at home along with her husband in an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. The bombing also killed six members of the a-Tanani family - the father, the pregnant mother, and their four children, who were minors - as they were trying to flee their home. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Rawyah Fathi Hassan a-Tanani
Notes: Killed while three months pregnant, along with her husband and their four children, who were minors, as they were trying to flee their home during an airstrike on nine homes near a-Sheikh Zayed Square. A Hamas military wing operative who lived nearby was not home at the time of the attack.

Name: Nisrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares
Notes: Killed at home with her two sisters and her infant nephew. Another neighbor was killed at home, as well as a neighbor who was standing in his doorway.

Name: Ni'mah Saleh Salamah 'Ayash
Notes: Killed at home by shelling of the Abu Fares family home nearby. Three sisters and an infant from the Abu Fares family were killed, as well as another neighbor who standing in his doorway.

Name: Sabrin Naser Muhammad Abu Fares (Abu Diyah)
Notes: Killed with her infant son and her two sisters in their father's house. A neighbor who was at home and another neighbor who was standing in his doorway were also killed in the attack.

Name: Manar Khader Ahmad 'Issa
Notes: Killed at home with her daughter, a minor. Her husband and other people were injured.

Name: Siham Yusef Mahmoud a-Rantisi
Notes: Killed at home with her son, a Hamas military wing operative, with her daughter-in-law and with her infant grandson, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Shaimaa Diab Muhammad a-Rantisi
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, a Hamas military wing operative, with her mother-in-law and with her infant nephew, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building.

Name: Khulud Fouad Farhan a-Zamli
Notes: Killed at home with her infant daughter, in an airstrike on the extended family's residential building. Nine members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Walaa Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed in her parents' home with her father and two of her sisters while six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Warda Muhammad Ibrahim Aman
Notes: Killed at home with her father and two of her sisters, one of whom was six months pregnant. Her mother, her two brothers and 25 other people were injured in the attack. A Hamas military wing operative who lived in the two-story building was away at the time, and it is unclear whether he was the target of the attack. A nearby four-story building was damaged.

Name: Mayami 'Abdallah Musa 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her daughter. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Hadil Khaled Mahmoud 'Arafah
Notes: Killed at home along with her mother. Three members of the family were injured.

Name: Maysoun Zaki Hashem al-Hittu
Notes: Killed along with her husband and a taxi driver who was driving the couple and their son to their daughters' house. In the attack, three other Palestinians were killed on the street, one by his house, and two by a sewing workshop belonging to one of them. Two of her children were injured, and another Palestinian on the street was severely injured.

Name: Rima Sa'ed Kamel a-Talbani
Notes: Killed at home along with her son and daughter, both minors, in an airstrike on their building. Her husband was severely injured in the attack. Two senior Hamas military wing operatives who were in the building, as well as a minor who was in a nearby building, were killed. Her daughter's body was extracted about nine days after the attack.

Name: Amirah 'Abd al-Fatah 'Abd a-Rahman Subuh
Notes: Killed along with her son, who had cerebral palsy, when a missile hit their sixth-floor apartment. Two other Palestinians were injured in the attack, one of them severely.

Name: Layali Taha A'bbas Sharir
Notes: Killed along with her 15-year-old daughter and her husband, a senior Hamas military wing operative, in an attack on their two-story building, which collapsed. Her toddler daughter was injured in the strike and succumbed to her wounds about a week later.

Name: Fahmiyah (Rihab) Muhammad Musa al-Hrub
Notes: Critically wounded in the legs and abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire from several meters away, as she was advancing slowly towards them brandishing a knife. Succumbed to her wounds later that day.

Name: Yusra Muhammad 'Awwad a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with two of her minor children. Her husband, who was wounded, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. Her brother-in-law, his wife and three of their minor children, two of them toddlers, were also killed in the attack, and 8 other people, 7 of them minors, were wounded

Name: Maryam Salem Naser a-Sawarkah
Notes: Killed when the family homes were bombed along with her husband, their two toddlers, and her husband’s son from a previous marriage. Her brother-in-law, who was wounded in the attack, died of his wounds on 22 November 2019. His wife and their two minor children were also killed and eight other people, seven of them minors, were wounded.

Name: Asmaa Muhammad Hassan Abu al-'Ata
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed. Her husband, a senior operative in the military wing of the Islamic Jihad was also killed in the attack, and four of their children were wounded, two of them minors, along with three other people.

Name: Nayfeh Muhammad 'Ali Ka'abneh
Notes: Hit by security guards’ gunfire after she approached them carrying a knife. Video footage of the incident posted on social media shows one of the guards firing at Ka’abneh from about 10 meters away. B’Tselem’s investigation found that she was not given any medical care for about half an hour. Ka’abneh was then taken to hospital where she was pronounced dead shortly after.

Name: Amani 'Atfat Sha'ban al-Madhun
Notes: Was heavily pregnant. Killed by shrapnel in an airstrike on her family’s home as was her brother-in-law, an Islamic Jihad military branch operative. Also injured in the airstrike were her father-in-law and a neighbor, both of whom succumbed to their wounds shortly after, and six minors.

Name: Iman 'Abdallah Musa Asraf (al-Ghazali)
Notes: Officer in the Hamas regime police. Killed together with her husband, three-month-old daughter, and three members of the Abu al-Jidyan family, one a minor, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower.

Name: Raghdah Muhammad Mahmoud Abu al-Jidyan
Notes: Killed together with her husband, son (a minor), and three members of the al-Ghazali family, including a three-month-old baby girl, when their apartments, which border one another, were bombed in the a-Sheikh Zayed Tower. Her body and that of her husband were located only the day after the bombing.

Name: Amal Mustafa Ahmad a-Taramsi
Notes: Died of her wounds shortly after being hit in the neck by Israeli security forces' gunfire while about 200 meters away from the Gaza perimeter fence during the Return Protests near the fence, east of Gaza City; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones, explosive devices and improvised grenades at Israeli security forces who were stationed on the other side of the fence.

Name: Inas Suliman Ahmad Abu Khamash
Notes: In the advanced stages of pregnancy. Killed with her toddler daughter while they were asleep at home, by a bomb that penetrated their home without exploding. Her husband was injured.

Name: Ruzan Ashraf 'Abd al-Qader a-Najar
Notes: Paramedic. Shot in the chest by Israeli security forces during the Return Protests near the Gaza perimeter fence, north of the town of Khuza’ah; thousands took part in the protests. During the demonstration, some of the demonstrators torched tires and threw stones at Israeli security forces stationed on the other side of the fence. B’Tselem’s investigation found that a-Najar was shot about 25 meters from the fence and some 10 meters from the demonstrators, while wearing a medic’s uniform.

Name: Siham Rateb Rashid Nimer
Notes: Fatally shot at Damascus Gate by Border Police officers after she brandished a pair of scissors at them; there was a metal police barrier between her and the officers.

Name: Rahiq Shaji' Muhammad Yusef
Notes: Shot dead by Border Police at Za'tara (Tapuach) Junction. According to the police, she was shot after she approached the officers brandishing a knife. Video footage broadcast by the media shows police firing some 30 bullets at her as she lay wounded on the ground, posing no danger to anyone.

Name: Sarah Dawood 'Ata Hajuj
Notes: Shot and killed by a Border Police officer who was standing at the entrance to a small room where Hajuj was being held. B’Tselem’s inquiry indicates that she had apparently pulled out a knife, and the officers in the room pepper-sprayed her in the face and fled from the room. The shots were fired after Hajuj was alone in the room and posed no danger to anyone.

Name: al-Majd 'Abdallah 'Abdallah al-Khadur
Notes: Shot and killed by soldiers after deliberately ramming her car into another car that was at a hitchhiking station at the entrance to Kiryat Arba.

Name: Ansar Husam Hifzi Harshah
Notes: Shot and killed by soldiers at ‘Anabta Checkpoint. She had arrived at the checkpoint armed with a knife. Shot when she no longer posed a danger.

Name: Sawsan 'Ali Dawood Mansur
Notes: Shot dead at the Bidu checkpoint. According to a statement by the Israel Police Spokesperson, she was shot when she approached the checkpoint, knife in hand, and did not heed calls by the police to halt

Name: Zanah 'Atiyyah Muhammad al-'Amur
Notes: Killed by a tank shell, while working in an agricultural field about half a kilometer from the perimeter fence. According to media reports, the Israeli military stated it had fired at people launching mortar shells. B’Tselem’s inquiry found that no mortars were fired from that area, either at the time she was killed on in the preceding days.

Name: Maram Saleh Hassan Abu Isma'il
Notes: Shot dead by security guards at Qalandia Checkpoint after throwing a knife at security personnel stationed at the checkpoint from some 15 meters away. She posed no real danger to anyone at the time she was shot. Her 16-year-old brother who was with her was shot dead immediately afterwards. According to media reports, the investigation found that she was shot twice from behind, once in the back and once in the buttocks.

Name: Fadwa Ahmad Muhammad Abu Teir
Notes: Shot dead when she tried to stab Border Police officers on al-Wad (Ha-Gai) Street.

Name: Amani Hussni 'Abdallah Sabatin
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers at Gush Etzion Junction after she hit a military officer with her car and was suspected of perpetrating an attack. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, the officer sustained light injuries.

Name: Kalzar Muhammad 'Abd al-Halim Muhammad 'Azmi al-'Awiwi
Notes: Shot dead at al-Awqaf (Tnuva) Checkpoint near the Tomb of the Patriarchs, after stabbing a Palestinian civilian. According to a statement by the IDF Spokesperson, no soldiers were injured in the incident.

Name: Mahdiyah Muhammad Ibrahim Hammad
Notes: Killed by Border Police gunfire while driving her car. According to a statement by the police, the shots were fired during an attempted vehicle attack. B’Tselem’s inquiry has called this contention into question as Hammad slowed her car down as she approached the officers.

Name: Maram Ramez 'Abed Hasunah
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers at Einav Checkpoint when she approached it, knife in hand.

Name: Samah 'Abd al-Mumin Ahmad 'Abdallah
Notes: Critically wounded by soldiers’ gunfire as while crossing she passed through a checkpoint in a car, with relatives. According to media reports, the gunfire was targeting a Palestinian youth who was had tried trying to stab Israelis at a nearby hitchhiking station. He, too, was killed. Died of her wounds at a hospital in Israel.

Name: Rasha Muhammad Hamed Rayan
Notes: Shot dead at HaPerot (the Fruit) Checkpoint by security guards from the Land Crossings Authority after drawing a knife and not heeding their calls to halt, when she was about 10 meters away from them.

Name: Tharwat Ibrahim Suliman a-Sha'rawi
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers standing on a road, after they suspected she was trying to run some of them over. The soldiers continued firing at her even after the car passed them.

Name: Nur Rasmi Muhammad Hassan
Notes: Killed along with her three-year-old daughter when their home was bombed.

Name: Hadil Salah a-Din Sadeq al-Hashlamun
Notes: Fatally wounded by soldiers’ gunfire at the Police (Shoter) Checkpoint, while carrying a concealed knife on her person. Soldiers called for her stop as she was on her way out of the checkpoint, fired at her legs, then immediately fired at her upper body. She died of her wounds later the same day.

Name: Farhanah Ibrahim Taleb al-'Attar
Notes: Killed when she returned to her home, which she had evacuated earlier, in order to take clothes.

Name: Rawyah Ibrahim Muhammad Judah
Notes: Killed with two of her daughters and two of her sons in the yard of their home in the Tel a-Za’tar neighborhood.

Name: Nisreen Ibrahim Isma'il Ahmad
Notes: Killed at home with her seven-year-old son, a twin, in the bombing of an adjacent four-story building that had been evacuated. Her seven-year-old daughter was injured. A young woman who had returned to the evacuated building to pick up an item was also killed.

Name: Suhair 'Abd al-Karim Hamad Abu Madyan
Notes: Killed when she went to pick up an item from her apartment in a building that had been evacuated, and the building was then bombed. In an adjacent building, a mother and her seven-year-old son were killed, and the boy’s twin sister injured.

Name: Hayat 'Abd Rabo Suliman Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed while asleep at home, when the nearby homes of her brother and nephew were bombed. Her nephew, his wife and their two children were also killed in the bombing.

Name: Huda Muhammad Khamis Abu Dahruj
Notes: Killed with her husband and two children when thier home and that of her father-in-law were bombed. Her husband’s aunt, who lived in a nearby home, was also killed.

Name: Amal Ibrahim Ahmad Yunes
Notes: Killed at home with her husband and granddaughter in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. A member of the ‘Aytah family, a woman, was killed in a nearby home. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Nazirah Ramadan Isma'il Kulab
Notes: Killed with three of her sons and three Hamas military branch operatives when her home was bombed. In nearby homes, three members of the Yunes family and a woman, a member of the ‘Aytah family, were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: 'Aishah Isma'il Hassan 'Atiyyah
Notes: Killed at home in the bombing of the nearby home of the Kulab family. Four members of the family and three Hamas military branch operatives were killed in the Kulab home. In a nearby home, three members of the Yunes family were killed as well. A man from the Abu Abu Salimah family was injured in a nearby building and later died of his wounds.

Name: Nabilah 'Eid Salamah a-Loh
Notes: Killed at home with her husband and three children. She was nine months pregnant. After she died, the fetus was delivered by C-section, but died later that day. In the neighboring home two of his brothers were killed. Another relative, a young woman, was also injured in another nearby home and later died of her injuries.

Name: Widad Mustafa Harb a-Deif
Notes: Wife of Muhammad a-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch. Killed with her two-year-old daughter and seven-month-old baby boy in their home the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Three neighbors, members of the a-Dalu family, one of them a minor and another a Hamas military branch operative, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Wafa Hussein Ahmad a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with her two sons, one of them a minor and the other a Hamas military branch operative, in their apartment in a building in the a-Sheikh Radwan neighborhood, Gaza City. Muhammad A-Deif, head of the Hamas military branch, also lived in that building. A-Deif’s wife and their two children, a two-year-old girl and a seven-month old baby boy, were also killed in the strike.

Name: Amani al-'Abed Mahmoud Barakah
Notes: Killed in her home.

Name: Karam Mahrus Hmeidan Khatab
Notes: Killed at the home of relatives. She had fled there from her Rafah home.

Name: Sumayah 'Abed Hamad Dheir
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Ibtesam Ibrahim Muhammad al-Bakri
Notes: Killed together with five other members of her family in their home.

Name: Khitam Jum'ah Turban a-Shalalfeh
Notes: Killed in her home together with her husband, who was an operative in the armed wing of Hamas. Their son was injured and died about a month later of his injuries.

Name: Amani Fadel Salem Abu Jazar
Notes: Killed together with her daughter and son in their home.

Name: Najah Rajab Mahmoud a-Sharafi
Notes: Killed with her son and her husband's nephew while she was sitting in the yard of her home kneading dough.

Name: Nadiah Fawzi Hussein Abu Hamad
Notes: Killed together with nine other people in an UNRWA school where her family had found shelter. Two people who were passing by the school on a motorbike were also killed in the strike.

Name: Suha Hamed 'Abd al-Karim Nijem al-Masri
Notes: Killed in her home together with her daughter and a relative who had found shelter in their home in a strike on the neighboring home of the Nijem family, in which five other members of the family and two operatives in the armed wing of Islamic Jihad were killed.

Name: Asmaa Isma'il Muhammad Jum'ah al-Ghul
Notes: Killed with her parents, sister, two brothers and three nephews as they slept in their home in the Bshit neighborhood. Eight other members of the family were injured.

Name: Hanadi Isma'il Muhammad Jum'ah al-Ghul
Notes: Killed with her parents, sister, two brothers and three nephews as they slept in their home in the Bshit neighborhood. Eight other members of the family were injured.

Name: Khadrah Khaled Ibrahim al-Ghul
Notes: Killed with her husband, four children and three grandchildren as they slept in their home in the Bshit neighborhood. Eight other members of the family were injured.

Name: Fatimah Muhammad Mahmoud Abu 'Amrah
Notes: Injured in her home when the home of the al-Khattab family was bombed. The strike also killed seven members of the al-Khattab family and Two other neighbors.

Name: Safaa 'Atwah Suliman Khatab
Notes: Killed at home with her parents, sister, two brothers and her sister-in-law. Three neighbors were also killed in the bombing.

Name: Nivin Suliman Salamah Khatab
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law and her two sisters-in-law. Three neighbors were also killed in the bombing.

Name: Amirah Ahmad 'Ali Khatab
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, four children and daughter-in-law. Three neighbors were also killed in the bombing.

Name: Ghaliah al-'Abed Ahmad Abu Raidah
Notes: Shot in the head. Her body was found lying in her the yard of her home.

Name: Ilham Muhammad Mahmoud 'Okal
Notes: Killed in her backyard.

Name: Turkiyyah Mahmoud 'Alian 'Okal
Notes: Killed together with her granddaughter and nephew when they fled from their home after her daughter-in-law was killed in a strike on the yard of the home.

Name: Jamileh Jamal Mahmoud Wahdan
Notes: Killed with her three-year-old daughter and two other relatives at the home of the al-Qumsan family, where they had taken refuge.

Name: Seniora Diab 'Abd al-Karim Wahdan
Notes: Killed with three relatives at the home of the al-Qumsan family, where they had taken refuge.

Name: Arwa Mahmoud Ahmud a-Nayrab
Notes: Killed at home with three of her daughters. Four neighbors were also killed in the strike.

Name: Sa'diyah Rizeq 'Abd a-Razeq Abu Taha
Notes: Killed with her infant grandson and two of her nephews in a home in which her family had taken shelter.

Name: Hakmeh 'Awwad 'Odeh al-'Arjani
Notes: Killed together with three other members of her family in the yard of her home.

Name: Ghadir Muhammad Suliman al-'Arjani
Notes: Killed together with three other members of her family in the yard of her home.

Name: Sa'diyah Rizeq 'Abd a-Razeq Abu Taha
Notes: Killed in her home together with three other members of her family. The house was bombarded after a missile was fired from the area.

Name: Nihaya Sa'di 'Issa 'Abd al-Wahab
Notes: Killed with her uncle, three brothers and four children in her uncle's home in the al-Jinenah neighborhood to which her family had fled, in a strike on three of the family’s homes.

Name: Fidaa Yusef Muhammad Abu Suliman
Notes: Killed at home. In nearby houses, her sister-in-law with her four children, a niece and two women neighbors were killed.

Name: Maryam Hassan 'Ali Abu Jazar
Notes: Killed in her daughter’s home. It abuts the home of the Abu Suleiman family which was bombed. The bombing killed seven members of that Abu Suleiman family as well as a neighbor woman in a nearby home.

Name: 'Abir Sa'id Sha'ban Abu 'Arab
Notes: Killed in the bombing of the nearby home of the Abu Suleiman family. The bombing killed seven members of that Abu Suleiman family as well as a neighbor woman in a nearby home.

Name: Hibah Hassan 'Abd a-Rahman Abu Suliman
Notes: Killed at home with her four children. In nearby houses, her sister-in-law, her husband’s niece and two women neighbors were killed.

Name: Najiyah Yusef 'Alian al-Masri
Notes: Killed together with six other members of her family while they were sitting in the yard of their home.

Name: Fayzeh Jermi 'Atiyyah a-Tarabin
Notes: Killed together with her husband and their son and daughter when they tried to flee from their home.

Name: Maryam Hussein Salamah a-Tarabin
Notes: Killed together with her parents and brother when they tried to flee from their home.

Name: Yusra Muhammad Salman Jazar
Notes: Killed with her husband when they returned to their home during the humanitarian truce.

Name: Amneh Saber Muhammad a-Zamli
Notes: Killed together with her husband when they tried to return to the school where they had found refuge, after visiting their home due to the declaration of the ceasefire.

Name: Hanan 'Abd a-Latif Dakhlallah Gheith
Notes: Killed with her husband, son and granddaughter in the living room of their home.

Name: Su'ad Jum'ah Hammad a-Tarabin
Notes: Killed together with 12 relatives in whose home she took shelter, and a baby in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: 'Aziza Mahmoud Salamah al-Mahmum
Notes: Killed together with 11 other members of her family, a family member who took shelter in their home and a in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: Wafa Salem Suliman al-Mahmum
Notes: Killed together with 11 other members of her family, a family member who took shelter in their home and a baby in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: Iqzayah Hammad Salman al-Mahmum
Notes: Killed together with 11 other members of her family, a family member who took shelter in their home and a baby in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: 'Itaf Hammad Salman al-Mahmum
Notes: Killed together with 11 other members of her family, a family member who took shelter in their home and a baby in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: Ibtesam Hammad Salman al-Mahmum
Notes: Killed together with 11 other members of her family, a family member who took shelter in their home and a baby in his mother's arms, in the street, after fleeing their home on al-Balbisi St.

Name: Fidiyyah Hmeidan Hammad Abu 'Emran
Notes: Killed in the home of relatives together with five members of her family. Two other relatives were wounded.

Name: Radyah Zayed Suliman Abu 'Emran
Notes: Killed in the home of relatives together with five members of her family. Two other relatives were wounded.

Name: Walaa Jamal Muhammad a-Namlah
Notes: Killed together with her husband and his sister on the street after fleeing their home in east Rafah, hoping to find shelter in downtown Rafah.

Name: 'Awatef 'Aziz a-Din 'Abd a-Shafi al-Farra
Notes: Killed together with eight members of her family after they left their house in an attempt to flee the spot during a bombing.

Name: Du'aa Ibrahim Mahmoud Sheikh al-'Eid
Notes: Killed together with six family members while standing together with other members near the al-Bar wa-Takwa Mosque, after they had fled from their home. A passerby was killed a few minutes earlier, and three paramedics were killed when another missile was fired at them as they attempted to rescue the members of the family.

Name: Soheila Ahmad Mahmoud a-Nayrab
Notes: Killed with her husband and three children in their apartment in the a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Iman Nazmi Muhammad Madi
Notes: Killed together with five other members of her family in her home. Six other members of the family were injured.

Name: Raedah 'Abd Rabo Musa Abu Khatlah
Notes: Killed on Salah a-Din St.

Name: Fayzeh Harb Muhammad Abu Mor
Notes: Killed close to Abu Yusuf a-Najar Square.

Name: Safaa Hamad Sa'id Qishtah
Notes: Killed at home in her kitchen.

Name: Su'ad 'Ali Muhammad al-Bahri
Notes: Killed in the yard of her home together with her granddaughter.

Name: Nur Saleh Salamah Abu Mashi
Notes: Killed in her home. Five other members of her family were injured in the strike and a neighbor standing in the street was killed.

Name: Nuha Jamal Yusef Ghneim
Notes: Killed with her father-in-law in his home in a-Tanur neighborhood. Other members of the family were injured.

Name: Sabha Mustafa Darwish Zo'rub
Notes: Killed with 14 relatives in her daughter’s home to which she had fled. The bombing also killed a six-week-old baby boy in a neighboring home.

Name: Ahlam Nu'man Muhammad Siyam
Notes: Killed with her two children and 12 other relatives in her sister’s home to which her family had fled. The bombing also killed a six-week-old baby boy in a neighboring home.

Name: Su'ad Nu'man Muhammad Zo'rub
Notes: Killed with her four children and ten other relatives in her sister’s home to which her family had fled. The bombing also killed a six-week-old baby boy in a neighboring home.

Name: Sanaa Nu'man Muhammad Zo'rub
Notes: Killed at home with her husband, four of their children, her mother, two sisters and their six children who had taken shelter in their home. The bombing also killed a six-week-old baby boy in a neighboring home.

Name: Hanan Yusef Saleh Abu Ta'imah
Notes: Killed at home along with four other people, one of whom was a Hamas military branch operative.

Name: Maha 'Abd a-Nabi Salim Abu Hilal
Notes: Killed while she was in her home.

Name: Maryam Muhammad Muhammad Abu Jalalah
Notes: Injured in the bombing the al-Barakeh wastewater treatment facility in the a-Sheikh Zayed Sq. where many people had taken shelter. Earlier, rockets had been fired from that area.

Name: Siham Bashir Ahmad Sha'th
Notes: Killed at home. Her infant son was injured.

Name: Labibah Ibrahim Shaker Abu Shuqah
Notes: Killed together with eight other members of her family in the home of relatives where she had found shelter. Another member of the family was injured and died later of her injuries. The strike also killed a woman and two girls from the al-'Asar family.

Name: Ilham Ibrahim Shaker Abu Shuqah
Notes: Killed together with eight other members of her family in the home of relatives where she had found shelter. Another member of the family was injured and died later of her injuries. The strike also killed a woman and two girls from the al-'Asar family.

Name: 'Abir 'Amer 'Abd al-Hamid al-Bayumi
Notes: Killed together with eight other members of her family in the home of relatives where she had found shelter. Another member of the family was injured and died later of her injuries. The strike also killed a woman and two girls from the al-'Asar family.

Name: 'Abir Nahed Muhammad al-'Assar
Notes: Killed in her home together with her daughter and niece in a strike on the neighboring home of the al-Bayumi family, in which ten members of the extended al-Bayumi family were killed.

Name: Ni'mah Darwish Hussein Abu Shuqah
Notes: Killed together with eight other members of her family in the home of relatives where she had found shelter. Another member of the family was injured and died later of her injuries. The strike also killed a woman and two girls from the al-'Asar family.

Name: Zeinab Yusef 'Issa Zaqut
Notes: Injured in her daughter's home and died later of her injuries. Nine members of her extended family were killed, as well as a woman and two girls from the al-A'sar family in the neighboring house.

Name: Amal 'Abd al-Karim Suliman al-Masri
Notes: Killed together with three members of her family, riding in a car on their way back from visiting injured people at Shuhada al-Aqsa Hospital.

Name: Ilham Yihya Khamis a-Loh
Notes: Killed together with three members of her family, riding in a car on their way back from visiting injured people at Shuhada al-Aqsa Hospital.

Name: Meyasar Muhammad Mhareb a-T'aban
Notes: Killed in her home. Two of her children, aged seven and nine, were injured.

Name: Maryam Ahmad Muhammad Abu Hijazi
Notes: Killed in her home in the vicinity of Ma’an. Three homes were hit in the bombing, another six people were killed and about twenty injured.

Name: Subhiya Ibrahim Mustafa al-Ghalban
Notes: Killed in her home in the vicinity of Ma’an. Three homes were hit in the bombing, another six people were killed and about twenty injured.

Name: Zeinab Mahmoud Ahmad Abu Jazar
Notes: Killed in the home of relatives in the vicinity of Ma’an. Three homes were hit in the bombing, another six people were killed and about twenty injured.

Name: Aya Muhammad Yusef al-Khalili
Notes: Killed together with her husband, her daughter, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and their three children in her father-in-law's home while they were waiting for a taxi to evacuate them from the area due to intensifying strikes. The other members of the family had already left shortly before.

Name: Nidaa Ziad Ahmad al-Khalili
Notes: Killed together with her husband, her three children, her brother-in-law and sister-in-law, and their daughter in her father-in-law's home while they were waiting for a taxi to evacuate them from the area due to intensifying strikes. The other members of the family had already left shortly before.

Name: Mahdiyah Suliman Naser a-Raqab
Notes: Killed in a strike on land adjacent to her home.

Name: Iftikhar Muhammad 'Abd al-'Aziz a-Zari'i
Notes: Injured while sitting in the shade of a tree in the yard in her home. Died shortly afterwards of her injuries.

Name: Wadi'ah Muhammad Kheir Sa'id a-Zein
Notes: Killed at home when her neighborhood was shelled.

Name: 'Ayidah 'Iz a-Din 'Omar 'Abd a-Ghafur
Notes: Killed with her mother and daughter, in the mother's house in the neighborhood of Dahret a-Sheikh Muhammad.

Name: Siham Raji Khalil a-Najar
Notes: Killed together with her daughter and granddaughter in her home in the neighborhood of Dhahrat a-Sheikh Muhammad.

Name: Hanaa 'Ali Jaber Al-Hashash
Notes: A disabled woman, killed together with her three children and her husband's two sons from another wife, three of whom were operatives in the armed wing of Hamas. The neighbor, Muhammad al-Hashash was killed trying to rescue her.

Name: Falastin Muhammad Sa'id Abu Zeid
Notes: Killed in her home together with six other members of her family. Two other members of the family were injured and died later of their injuries.

Name: Sabrin Khader Sa'id Abu Zeid
Notes: Killed in her home together with six other members of her family. Two other members of the family were injured and died later of their injuries.

Name: Maryam Marzuq 'Abd al-Karim Abu Zeid
Notes: Killed in her home together with six other members of her family. Two other members of the family were injured and died later of their injuries.

Name: Widad Ahmad Salamah Abu Zeid
Notes: Killed in her home together with six other members of her family. Two other members of the family were injured and died later of their injuries.

Name: 'Aishah Salamah 'Abd al-Karim Abu 'Eid
Notes: Killed in her apartment on the second story of the a-Safa tower. Three other members of her family were injured.

Name: Sabrin Muhammad 'Atiyyah Abu Khusah
Notes: Killed together with six other members of her family, including her two children, in a strike on her parents' home, which collapsed on the people who were inside. Her husband was injured in the strike and died later.

Name: Sabah Mubarak Bheiri Abu Khusah
Notes: Killed in her home together with six other members of her family, when the house collapsed on the people who were inside. Another member of the family was injured in the strike and died later.

Name: Fatimah Muhammad Nimer Abu 'Arar
Notes: Killed in her home when two operatives in an armed wing passed by her. Her sister lost both her legs in the strike and their home was partially destroyed.

Name: 'Aliyyah Hussein Muhammad Qanan
Notes: Injured while searching for his brother how had been injured earlier. Died of his wounds on 10 October 2014.

Name: Soheila 'Abd al-Qader Muhammad al-Ja'el
Notes: Killed in her home together with her two granddaughters.

Name: Khulud Muhammad Isma'il Hamu
Notes: Killed in her apartment in a building in the town of a-Zahraa.

Name: Dima 'Abd al-Majid Muhammad Kallub
Notes: Injured in her home in a strike in which her four-year-old son was killed.

Name: 'Aishah Hamdan Muhammad a-Sa'ud
Notes: Killed in her parents' home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Anwaar Muhammad Salem Abu Jaber
Notes: Killed in her home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Lina Kifah Mahmoud Abu Jaber
Notes: Killed in her home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Sumayah 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad Abu Jaber
Notes: Killed in her home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Dina Hamdan Muhammad Abu Jaber
Notes: Killed in her parents' home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Faddah Ghanam Hassan Abu Jaber
Notes: Killed in her home together with 16 other members of her family and two other people in a strike on three homes of her extended family. The houses collapsed on the people who were inside.

Name: Sahar Mutawe' Muhammad Balatah
Notes: Killed in her brother-in-law's home together with her husband, her seven children, and two other members of her family. Her one-year-old grandson was injured and died of his injuries several days later.

Name: Maryam Na'im Nazmi Balatah
Notes: Killed in her uncle's home together with her parents, her five siblings, and two other members of her family. Her one-year-old nephew was injured and died of his injuries several days later.

Name: Du'aa Na'im Nazmi Balatah
Notes: Killed in her uncle's home together with her parents, her five siblings, and two other members of her family. Her one-year-old nephew was injured and died of his injuries several days later.

Name: Hanaa Na'im Nazmi Balatah
Notes: Killed in her uncle's home together with her parents, her five siblings, and two other members of her family. Her one-year-old nephew was injured and died of his injuries several days later.

Name: Wafa Na'im Nazmi Balatah
Notes: Killed in her uncle's home together with her parents, her five siblings, and two other members of her family. Her one-year-old nephew was injured and died of his injuries several days later.

Name: Aya Jamil Ahmad a-Najar
Notes: Killed together with 32 other people, including four of her brothers, her father, and her niece, in their apartment on the third story of a populated apartment block hit by a strike. The building collapsed on the people inside, all of whom were killed, including a family that had found shelter in an abandoned kindergarten on the first story. A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: Muna Hajjaj Ibrahim Abu 'Amer
Notes: Killed together with 32 other people, including her husband and her five children, in a strike on an inhabited apartment block in which the family had found refuge in an abandoned kindergarten. The building collapsed on the people inside, all of whom were killed. A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: Basemah Salem Salim Breikah
Notes: Killed together with 32 other people, including her husband, two of her daughters, her sister-in-law, and her mother-in-law, in a strike on an inhabited apartment block in which the family had found refuge in an abandoned kindergarten. The building collapsed on the people inside, all of whom were killed. A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: Subhiya Muanis Mahmoud Breikah
Notes: Killed together with 32 other people, including two of her sons, her mother-in-law, and two of her granddaughters, in their apartment on the second story of a populated apartment block hit by a strike. The building collapsed on the people inside, all of whom were killed, including a family that had found shelter in an abandoned kindergarten on the first story. A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: Walaa Jamil Ahmad a-Najar
Notes: Killed together with 32 other people, including four of her brothers, her father, and her niece, in their apartment on the third story of a populated apartment block hit by a strike. The building collapsed on the people inside, all of whom were killed, including a family that had found shelter in an abandoned kindergarten on the first story. A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: 'Orubah Suliman Ahmad Abu 'Amer

A girl in a neighboring house was also killed in the attack.

Name: Shuruq Mahmoud Salamah Dheir
