Notes: A live-in resident of a special-needs hostel run by Mabarrah, an NGO. Had cerebral palsy. Killed along with another resident when the hostel was bombed. Three hostel residents were injured.

Name: Suha Musbah Ahmad Abu S'adah
Notes: A live-in resident of a special-needs hostel run by Mabarrah, an NGO. Killed along with another resident when the hostel was bombed. Three hostel residents were injured.

Name: Khawlah Mahmoud Sarhan al-Hawajri
Notes: Killed in her fourth-floor home, by shrapnel from the bombing of a nearby building, which was hit after the people inside had been warned of the impending strike.

Name: Kifah Shaker Diab al-Ghannam
Notes: Killed along with four members of her family when their home collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Ghaliah Dib Jaber al-Ghannam
Notes: Killed along with four members of her family when their home collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Wisam 'Abd a-Razeq Hassan al-Ghannam
Notes: Killed along with four members of her family when their home collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Najlaa Mahmoud Lutfi al-Haj
Notes: Killed along with seven members of her family when their house collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Asmaa Mahmoud Lutfi al-Haj
Notes: Killed along with seven members of his family when their house collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Basemah 'Abd al-Qader Muhammad al-Haj
Notes: Killed along with seven members of his family when their house collapsed on them due to a strike.

Name: Amal Yusef 'Abed 'Abd a-Ghafur
Notes: Killed with her infant daughter in their home in the a-Ghawafir neighborhood.

Name: Asmaa Hani Saleh Hamad
Notes: Killed with her father and brother, who was an operative in the military branch of Hamas, in the yard of their home.

Name: Selmiyeh Hassan Muslem al-'Arja
Notes: Killed when part of ‘Atiyyah Muhammad al-‘Arja’s home collapsed on top of her after a missile was fired at nearby farmland. A 9-year-old girl was also killed in the incident.

Name: Nayfeh Muhammad Taher Frajallah
Notes: Killed while passing through farmland close to her home.

Name: 'Aishah Shabib Mahmoud a-Nawasrah
Notes: Five months pregnant. Killed at home with her husband and his two nephews.

Name: Sahar Hassan 'Ali al-Masri
Notes: Killed in the street along with her two children and a relative who was an operative in the military branch of the Islamic Jihad and was standing nearby.

Name: Hanaa Muhammad Fuad Yusef Malka
Notes: Killed at home along with her husband and son. Their daughter was injured in the incident and died of her wounds several days later.

Name: Dina Mahdi Muhammad Hamad
Notes: Killed at home along with five other members of her family when her uncle Hafez Hamad was assassinated.

Name: Suha Hamad Ahmad Hamad
Notes: Killed at home along with five other members of her family when Hafez Hamad was assassinated.

Name: Rasmiya Khalil Mahmoud Hamad
Notes: Killed at home along with five other members of her family when her son Hafez Hamad was assassinated.

Name: Amneh 'Atiyyah Mahmoud Qdeih
Notes: Mentally disturbed. Hit after dark by firing from military tower while she was near Gaza border fence. Her body was found by relatives the next morning.

Name: Lubna Munir Sa'id al-Hanash
Notes: Hit by shots a soldier fired near Route 60 while she was walking on the grounds of Al-‘ Arrub College, after a Molotov cocktail was thrown at an Israeli car traveling along the road ahead of the vehicle in which the soldier who fired and the second-in-command of the Yehuda Brigade were passengers.

Name: Yusra Basel Murtada a-Shawa
Notes: Killed in the bombing of her house in a-Shujayah, Gaza City, shortly after the passage of a calvacade of Arab foreign ministers and the Turkish foreign minister. Three other civilians, who were watching the calvacade, were killed on the street.

Name: Nasmah Helmi Salem Abu Zor
Notes: Killed while running from her house after it was damaged in the bombing of a nearby house belonging to an Islamic Jihad activist. Three other civilians were also killed.

Name: Sahar Fadi As'ad Abu Zor
Notes: Killed while running from her house after it was damaged in the bombing of a nearby house belonging to an Islamic Jihad activist. Three other civilians were also killed.

Name: Sabah Muhammad Harb a-Skafi
Notes: Wounded on her way from the UNRWA clinic in a-Tofah to her house in a-Shujayah in Gaza City.

Name: Sa'diyah Muhammad 'Aydi a-Dib
Notes: Killed while she was feeding the chickens she raised on farmland near her house in a-Shujayah, Gaza City.

Name: Nawal Faraj Mahmoud 'Abd al-'Aal
Notes: Killed in her home in a-Tofah in Gaza City, during the bombing of the police station nearby.

Name: Amineh Matar Hassan al-Mzannar
Notes: Killed with her grandson in the bombing of the a-Dalu family's house next door, in which nine members of the a-Dalu family were killed.

Name: Tahani Hasunah Ahmad a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with another nine members of her family in their house. Also killed in that bombing were two members of the al-Maznar family from the house next door.

Name: Samah 'Abd al-Hamid Ishaq a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with nine other members of her family while they were at home. In that bombing two members of the al-Maznar family in the house next door were also killed.

Name: Soheila Mahmoud Yasin a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with another nine members of her family in their house. Also killed in that bombing were two members of the al-Maznar family from the house next door.

Name: Ranin Jamal Mahmoud a-Dalu
Notes: Killed with another nine members of her family in their house. Also killed in that bombing were two members of the al-Maznar family from the house next door.

Name: Samaher Khalil Mahmoud Qdeih
Notes: Killed when she left her house to go with her family to a more secure house.

Name: Tahrir Ziad Muhammad Salman
Notes: Killed while sitting in her yard with other family members, one of whom was also killed in the bombing.

Name: Fayzeh Muhammad Mustafa al-Hassumi
Notes: Killed together with her father while they tried to extinguish a fire caused by a rocket that landed on their farmland.

Name: Najah Harb Salem Qdeih
Notes: Killed with her daughter while standing at the entrance to their house.

Name: Nidal Ibrahim Hamdan Qdeih
Notes: Killed with her mother while standing at the entrance to their house.

Name: Ne'meh Yusef Muhisen a-Nabahin
Notes: Killed when struck by a shell while standing outside of her house.

Name: Intesar Farid Suliman al-Masri
Notes: Killed when she returned to see the condition of her house, which was situated close to the border.

Name: Ghanimah Ma'sud Nimer Abu Halimah
Notes: A disabled person, she remained at home when her family transferred to the UNRWA-school compound as she was unable to walk and Red Cross personnel were unable to get to the house to take her.

Name: Mahdiyeah Suliman Muhammad 'Ayad
Notes: Shot with her husband by soldiers while they were fleeing from their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Fatimah 'Awad Khalil Ghaben
Notes: Killed while on her way home.

Name: Maryam Mutawe'a Nasrallah Mutawe'aen
Notes: Her body was found under the ruins of her house, which had been shelled and then demolished by bulldozers.

Name: Fatimah Mahmoud 'Obeid 'Abdallah
Notes: Killed while at home in the 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo neighborhood.

Name: Bisan 'Iz a-Din Muhammad Abu al-'Eish
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in 'Izbet 'Abd Rabo.

Name: Zakiyyeh 'Abd al-Hai 'Ali Abu 'Aytah
Notes: Killed while in front of her house with three members of her family.

Name: Manal Hassan 'Ali al-Batran
Notes: Killed when her house was bombed, apparently with the aim of killing her husband.

Name: Samah 'Atiyyah Muhammad Siyam
Notes: Sister-in-law of Sa'id Siyam, she was killed with her husband in the bombing of Siyam's house.

Name: Iman 'Abd al-Qader Jebril Islim
Notes: Killed in the bombing of the house of Sa'id Siyam.

Name: Amal 'Ayad 'Odeh Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her mother-in-law and her three children when they came to check their house, which had been bombed.

Name: 'Aishah 'Ayad 'Eid Irmeilat
Notes: Killed with her daughter-in-law and her three grandchildren when they came to check their house that had been bombed.

Name: Ihssan Mahmoud Zaki al-Hadad
Notes: Burned to death with her husband and two children when the car in which they were fleeing from their home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood was bombed with phosphorous.

Name: Layla Rashed Wahdan Abu 'Aqleen
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Rajaa Muhammad Ramadan Ghaben
Notes: Killed while standing at the entrance to her house.

Name: Kafa Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman a-Nazer
Notes: Killed when she went outside to care for her neighbors Hanan and 'Aishah a-Najar, who were wounded when the yard of their house was shelled.

Name: Hanan Sha'ban 'Urabi a-Najar
Notes: Killed with her infant daughter as she ran towards her children who had been hit by a bombing in the yard of their house.

Name: Samira 'Afif Hassan Musa
Notes: Killed while at home with her family in the a-Sabra neighborhood.

Name: Kafa Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahman a-Neder
Notes: Killed when she went to help wounded women and children who were near her house.

Name: Shadyah Ahmad Jaber
Notes: Killed with her husband in the bombing of their apartment in a residential building.

Name: Halimah Muhammad Muhammad Siyam
Notes: Killed when she came out of her house to aid relatives whose house had been bombed. Bulldozers demolished the house, leaving her body underneath the ruins.

Name: Nazirah Muhammad Khaled Abu al-Kas (al-Hilu)
Notes: Killed with her husband while they were at home.

Name: Rasha Ahmad Khalil a-Smeiri
Notes: Killed while riding a horse-drawn wagon on her way to visit relatives.

Name: Firyal Kamal Mahmoud al-Bana
Notes: Killed along with three other persons, among them a doctor who was trying to help the wounded, in a shelling of the apartment building in which she lived.

Name: Rawheyeh Ahmad Suliman a-Najar
Notes: Killed while walking at the head of a group of women carrying a white flag after soldiers had called to residents to leave their houses.

Name: 'Afaf Rabi' Hassan Jum'ah
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Jamileh Hassan Ziyadah Ziyadah
Notes: Killed immediately after exiting her house with members of her family to care for wounded persons.

Name: Mudallaleh Ahmad Muhammad Abu Rakbah
Notes: Killed while fleeing with her family from their house after their neighbor's house was bombed.

Name: Dalal 'Ashur As'ad al-Katati
Notes: Hit while at home.

Name: Randah Jamal Faraj 'Abd Rabo
Notes: Killed when a missile struck the grocery store of the 'Abd Rabo family.

Name: In'am 'Abed Darwish al-Baba
Notes: Killed while sitting with her family in the yard of their house.

Name: Hanan Fathi 'Abd al-Ghani a-Najar
Notes: Killed while she fled with her family to her parents' house after her house had been destroyed by the army.

Name: Randah Faiz Muhammad Salhah
Notes: Killed at home with her four children and her sister.

Name: Fatimah Faiz Muhammad al-Hilu
Notes: Killed while visiting her sister's home.

Name: Sumayah Jum'ah Sa'id Sa'ed
Notes: Killed while standing in front of her house with members of her family.

Name: Fatimah Sa'id Mustafa Sa'ed
Notes: Killed while standing in front of her house with members of her family.

Name: Amal Ahmad Yasin al-Madhun
Notes: Wounded while at home and died later.

Name: Halimah Isma'il Ibrahim Saleh
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Maathar Muhammad Salem Zneid
Notes: Killed while fleeing with her family from their house to the local school.

Name: Faten 'Abd al-'Aziz Silmi Zneid
Notes: Killed while fleeing with her family from their house to a school in the area.

Name: Ruqayah Muhammad Muhammad Abu a-Naja
Notes: Killed along with her son-in-law, Ihab al-Wahidi, in her home in the Tel al-Hawa neighborhood.

Name: Nujud Rajab Swelem Ghaben
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Albina Vladimir Yusef al-Jaru
Notes: Killed with her infant son while they were at home.

Name: Bader Muhammad Musa Abu Rashed
Notes: Killed while at home with her family.

Name: Hakmeh 'Abd a-Rahman Mustafa al-'Attar
Notes: Killed next to her house.

Name: Islam Isma'il Suliman 'Abd al-Jawad
Notes: Killed while she was at home when the house of her neighbor, a Hamas operative, was bombed.

Name: Fidaa Farid Salamah Abu Sh'ar
Notes: Killed when she went looking for her husband, Mahmud Abu Sh'ar, who had been shot and killed on his way home.

Name: Khadijeh 'Abd a-Razeq 'Abd al-Fatah Zamlat
Notes: Killed while at home with her son. Her grandson was wounded and died later from his wounds.

Name: Heijar Isma'il Yusef Nseiwi
Notes: Killed while at home as a result of the bombing of a neighbor's house.

Name: Kawkab Sa'id Hussein a-Dayah
Notes: Killed along with 21 relatives when the house in which they were in was bombed. The army admitted that the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family had not been warned of the army's intention to bomb it.

Name: Sabrin Faiz Mesbah a-Dayah
Notes: Killed with 21 members of her family when their house was bombed. Later, the army admitted the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family was not given warning of the intention to bomb it.

Name: Raghdah Faiz Mesbah a-Dayah
Notes: Killed with 21 members of her family when their house was bombed. Later, the army admitted the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family was not given warning of the intention to bomb it.

Name: Rawdah Hilal Hussein a-Dayah
Notes: Killed with 21 members of her family when their house was bombed. Later, the army admitted the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family was not given warning of the intention to bomb it.

Name: Tazal Isma'il Muhammad a-Dayah
Notes: Killed with 21 members of her family when their house was bombed. Later, the army admitted the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family was not given warning of the intention to bomb it.

Name: Safaa Saleh Muhammad a-Dayah
Notes: Killed with 21 members of her family when their house was bombed. Later, the army admitted the house had been bombed by mistake, and that the family was not given warning of the intention to bomb it.

Name: 'Afaf Muhammad al-'Abed Dmeidah
Notes: Killed while hanging laundry on the roof of her house.

Name: Hibah Jamil 'Ali 'Amshah
Notes: Killed when she tried to return home to get provisions.

Name: Mahzeyah Shihadah Hassan Saleh
Notes: Killed while at home with her husband, daughter, and daughter-in-law.

Name: Samia Fathi 'Abd al-Fatah Saleh
Notes: Killed while at home with her husband's parents and sister.

Name: Rihab 'Abd al-Men'em Ramadan 'Awad
Notes: Killed by mortar fire that hit the street next to UNRWA's al-Fakhura school, in the Jabalya refugee camp, where persons had gone for refuge after they had to leave their houses. Earlier, militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Khadrah 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Abd al-'Aziz 'Awad
Notes: Killed by mortar fire that hit the street next to UNRWA's al-Fakhura school, in the Jabalya refugee camp, where persons had gone for refuge having been forced to leave their houses. Earlier, militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Amal Matar Saleh Dib
Notes: Killed with ten members of her family while she was standing in the entrance to her house, near al-Fakhura School. Earlier, armed militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Fatimah Samir Shafiq Dib
Notes: Killed with ten members of her family while she was standing in the entrance to her house, near al-Fakhura School. Earlier, armed militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Alaa Mu'in Shafiq Dib
Notes: Killed with ten members of her family while she was standing in the entrance to her house, near al-Fakhura School. Earlier, armed militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Shammah Salem Hussein Dib
Notes: Killed with ten members of her family in her home, near al-Fakhura School. Earlier, armed militants had fired rockets from the area.

Name: Nahil Khaled 'Abd a-Rahman Abu 'Eishah
Notes: Killed at home with her husband and her three children in a-Nasser neighborhood, some 200 meters from the Internal Ministry headquarters and the former Palestinian Intelligence headquarters. B'Tselem's investigation indicates that armed militants apparently were not present in the area.

Name: Nai Faiz Yusef Hassan
Notes: Killed at home together with her father.

Name: Wafa Nabil 'Ali Abu Jarad
Notes: Killed by flechette-shell darts while in a condolence tent. Five other persons were killed in the incident.

Name: 'Ula Ma'sud Khalil 'Arafat
Notes: Killed by soldiers' firing in a-Zaitun neighborhood along with Shahd Haji and Muhammad Samir Haji, as they tried to get to a safe place together with other civilians.

Name: Salimeh Mesleh Subhi Salam
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Khadrah al-'Abed Khalil al-Maleh
Notes: Killed at home in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood.

Name: Lubna Fouad Tawfiq al-Maleh
Notes: Killed at home in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood.

Name: Amal Zaki 'Aref 'Aleiwa
Notes: Killed with four of her children when a shell penetrated their fourth-floor apartment in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood.

Name: Kamleh 'Ali Mustafa al-'Attar
Notes: Refused to join her son and grandchildren when they fled from the house on 5 January '09. Her body was found in the house when her family returned, on 20 January.

Name: Fadwa Khalil Muhammad Kahil
Notes: Killed with two members of her family when their house in a-Zeitun neighborhood was bombed.

Name: Muti'ah 'Abd a-Rahman Ibrahim a-Samuni
Notes: Killed at the entrance to her house.

Name: Layla Nabih Mahmoud a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Rahmeh Muhammad Mahmoud a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Razaqeh Muhammad Mahmoud a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Rabab 'Izzat 'Ali a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Maha Muhammad Ibrahim a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Safaa Subhi Muhammad a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Hanan Khamis Sa'di a-Samuni
Notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

Name: Ibtesam Ahmad Muhammad al-Qanu'
Notes: Soldiers demolished her house with a bulldozer and shot and killed her when she exited the house with her mother-in-law, waving a white flag.

Name: Rida Khalil Hassan 'Ali
Notes: Killed while riding in a taxi with members of her family.

Name: Safeyeh Salem Hussein Haydar
Notes: Killed while next to her house.

Name: Jamileh 'Abd al-'Aziz Salem a-Da'ur
Notes: Her body and the body of her son were found bullet-ridden in their home.

Name: Ghadah Riyad Rajab Abu Halimah
Notes: Was severely burned when a white phosphorous shell struck her house, and died later from her wounds. Four others from her family were burned to death in the incident and her father-in-law was killed when struck directly by the shell. Four other family members, including her infant daughter, suffered burns.

Name: Majedah 'Abd al-Karim Abu Hajaj
Notes: Killed with her mother by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

Name: Rayah Salamah Salman Abu Hajaj
Notes: Killed with her daughter by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

Name: Iman Nimer Suliman al-'Arur
Notes: Killed at home with four members of her family.

Name: 'Awatef Salman Salamah Abu Khusah
Notes: Killed while trying to salvage the body of Iyad Khusah.

Name: Tahani Kamal Abu 'Aish
Notes: Killed when struck in the head with shrapnel. She was at home, about 700 meters from the Israeli border. The firing was apparently aimed at an adjacent site from which rockets had been fired.

Name: Fatimah Salah Isma'il Salah
Notes: Killed while she was at home with her family.

Name: Nawal Isma'il Rayan
Notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. According to officials, the army warned the family but they refused to leave the house.

Name: Hiyam 'Abd a-Rahman Rayan
Notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. According to officials, the army warned the family but they refused to leave the house.

Name: Iman Khalil Rayan
Notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

Name: Shirin Sa'id Rayan
Notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

Name: Fatimah Abu Jabah Faraj 'Alush
Notes: Killed at home.

Name: Iman Hassan Mahmoud Abu 'Aridah
Notes: Killed at her home from a missile the army fired on an adjacent park.

Name: Maysaa Munir Yihya Kashku
Notes: Killed while at her home in a-Zeitun neighborhood.

Name: Rawyah Rajab Ahmad 'Awad
Notes: Killed while waiting for a taxi next to the police station that was bombed in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood.

Name: Nazek Hassan Yasin Abu Rayya
Notes: Killed in Security and Defense Department headquarters.

Name: Ne'meh 'Ali Ahmad al-Maghari
Notes: Student at the UNRWA professional training center. She was killed with 12 other persons next to the center while waiting for a ride.

Name: Wafa Marwan 'Ali a-Dasuqi
Notes: Student at the UNRWA professional training center. She was killed with 12 other persons next to the center while waiting for a ride.

Name: Huda Hani Hussni Zuhd
Notes: Killed at police station near the Legislative Council building.

Name: Fadiyah Jaber Jaber Abu Hweige
Notes: Killed with her father and two brothers in their home next to a police station and a Hamas training base that were bombed.

Name: Sarah 'Eid 'Ali al-Hawajri
Notes: Killed in the bombing of the National Security building as she passed on her way to buy provisions at the market.

Name: Myasarah Muhammad Muhammad 'Udwan
Notes: Killed while on her way to buy provisions.

Name: Yusra Ibrahim Msallam Qdeih
Notes: Killed when standing in the doorway of her house during an army action in the Khaza'a area.

Name: Wafa Shaker Muhammad a-Daghameh
Notes: Killed when soldiers blew down the door of her house just as she was about to open it.

Name: Meyasar Mutlaq Rashid Abu Me'teq
Notes: Killed with her four children while eating breakfast in the yard of their house.

Name: Ghadah al-'Abed Ahmad Saleh
Notes: Killed in the kitchen of her house.

Name: Samah Zidan Muhammad Ghali 'Asaliyah
Notes: Killed when she was at home during the incursion into the area.

Name: Rajaa 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad 'Atallah
Notes: Killed when at home with her family during the incursion into the Jabalya refugee camp.

Name: Ibtesam 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad 'Atallah
Notes: Killed when at home with her family during the incursion into the Jabalya refugee camp.

Name: Su'ad Rajab Yusef 'Atallah
Notes: Killed when at home with her family during the incursion into the Jabalya refugee camp.

Name: Nuhad 'Abd al-Hadi Muhammad Daher
Notes: Killed by a missile that landed five meters from her as she tried to run from her home after a shell struck nearby.

Name: Haniyeh Hussein Muhammad 'Abd al-Jawad
Notes: Killed at her nephew's wedding, when a missile was fired at the nearby Ministry of Interior building, which was abandoned.

Name: Maryam Ahmad Muhammad a-Rahel
Notes: Wanted. Killed in an exchange of gunfire with soldiers who had surrounded his house.

Name: Fathiya Yusef 'Omar al-Hassumi
Notes: Killed when riding in a car on the way home from the market.

Name: Khadrah Ahmad 'Ali Wahdan
Notes: Killed by return fire at Qassam rockets that were being fired at Israeli territory from the same area where he was located.

Name: Maysaa Nimer Muhammad Fanunah
Notes: Killed when she shot at the soldiers at a checkpoint, together with another armed person.

Name: Iman Muhammad Ibrahim Hamdan
Notes: Killed during the incursion when she and others in her family left the house after shots had been fired at it.

Name: Asmaa Hamdan 'Abd a-Rahim Fayad
Notes: Killed when she moved about with armed men during the army's incursion into the area.

Name: Karimah 'Abd a-Rahman Ahmad Fayad
Notes: Killed when she moved about with armed men during the army's incursion into the area.

Name: Khaldeyeh Ahmad Hamdan a-Talbani
Notes: Killed when soldiers opened fire at pilgrims from Mecca waiting at the checkpoint.

Name: Sabha Suliman Salman al-Qara
Notes: Killed when, during an army operation, she heard her son had been wounded and went outside to see how he was.

Name: Amal Shaker Zidan Dolah
Notes: Killed while walking near her home. Armed Palestinians were present in the area.

Name: Khairieh Ahmad Muhammad Nazzal
Notes: Killed when she went to help an injured person next to her house.

Name: Ibtesam Hassan Muhammad Abu Marseh
Notes: Killed while standing next to the window of her house fifteen minutes after armed men launched a Qassam rocket from the area and fled.

Name: Sa'diyah Hassan 'Atallah Hirzallah
Notes: Killed in her house during a operation to arrest Ayman Hasanein.

Name: Fatimah Ahmad Saleh al-'Athamneh
Notes: Killed while inside her home when Israeli artillery shells struck a residential neighborhood in Beit Hanun, killing 19 civilians, including 7 minors, and wounding some 40 others.

Name: Nihad Muhammad 'Abdallah al-'Athamneh
Notes: Killed while inside her home when Israeli artillery shells struck a residential neighborhood in Beit Hanun, killing 19 civilians, including 7 minors, and wounding some 40 others.

Name: Ne'meh Ahmad Muhammad al-'Athamneh (Abu Rukbeh)
Notes: Killed while inside her home when Israeli artillery shells struck a residential neighborhood in Beit Hanun, killing 19 civilians, including 7 minors, and wounding some 40 others.
